oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Relics found from around Carter County, Tennesee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Relics recovered from Carter County, Tennessee includes Sharps bullets a WWI overcoat button and a Texas cuff button. This model of Sharps bullet is known as a "ring tail" due to the additional lead base at the bottom of the bullet cavilty. This tail held the paper cartridge to the base of the bullet. The Sharps carbine was widely used by Union cavarly regiments and the Confederates made copies of the Sharps carbine in Richmond, Va.
